title: Twisted Tower
opening: Ike has avenged his father by defeating the Black Knight in single combat. That night, he sleeps until well past dawn. It is the first time since Greil's death that he has done so. The crimean army and its laguz allies have passed the trial of Nados Castle. At last, they've arrived at their final destination: the Crimean capital. Yet the opponent that awaits them is none other than Ashnard, king of Daein. If they lose here, all of their hardships will have been for naught. Preparations for the attack proceed with the utmost care. The final battle is approaching. An air of exaltation pervades the camp, but Ike remains focused on the road ahead, readying himself for what is to come.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: It appears that Leanne is being held in Gritnea Tower, to the south. That's right, isn't it, Ena?

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: Yes. That is correct.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: How do you know that?

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: I was searching for information, and that search led me to a troop of Daein soldiers that had been assigned to the tower. It was the extra knowledge I needed.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You won't tell me any more than that, will you? No matter how important it might be to our upcoming fight.

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: ...I beg your pardon.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I figured as much. I've already decided to trust you, so all that's left to do is move out.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: That's Gritnea Tower, right?

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: I believe so.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Say, Ike... There's something...really odd about that tower... Sniff...I mean REALLY odd...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What is it?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: I sense several of the beast tribe, but...what is that? ...Sniff... Ugh! Something smells terrible!

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: The tower holds laguz who have been given toxins, foul potions that warp their true shape.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Are you talking about the laguz that can't change forms? Like the ones we fought in Begnion?

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: ...Yes.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Do you know how many and what type are in there?

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: As far as numbers...a conservative estimate would be thirty. Types? There are tigers and cats from the beast tribes, hawks and ravens from the bird tribes, and...dragons...

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: There are some from the dragon tribes as well?

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: No more than ten. Er...Probably no more than ten...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We have to fight ten dragons like you?

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: They are not like me, Master Ike. They are much stronger.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: ...That's hardly encouraging...

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Regardless, we must hurry. It's going to be dark soon. It's rather embarrassing, but we of the bird tribes don't move well in the dark.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Sad but true. Of course, the same can be said for those on the enemy side as well.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: On the other hand, darkness means next to nothing for my kind. Depending on who we face, it could prove to be a significant--

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: There are more of the beast tribe than any other. It is because we are close to Gallia.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Listen, you... Are you sure you want to be on our side?

intro.speaker: Ena
intro.line: ...Hm? Yes, of course. That is why I provide accurate information.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Nasir!

intro.speaker: Nasir
intro.line: What do you think, Ranulf? My grandchild is impressive, is she not?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: That's not what I was going to say, Grandpa--

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So once it gets dark, we're going to be at a disadvantage. Right? All right, as long as we know that, we can plan for it.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: You're too calm about this for my tastes. This is going to be a--

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Enough, Ranulf! We don't have time for complaints. We need to find the entrance to the tower.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Yeah, yeah. I'm coming.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Look at this, will you? What a glorious mix of birds, beasts, and dragons we have to greet us.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: King of hawks! This is no joking matter! They--

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Hold on, my brothers. Just a little longer. Soon, I will grant you all release.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Oh...

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Tibarn is not the only one who is filled with rage. To warp the gift that the goddess has granted us...This crime shall not go unpunished! Yaaaaa!!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Prince Reyson...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Come, Ranulf, let's join them. We must rescue Leanne as soon as possible...for Reyson's sake as much as anything else.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Those poor laguz... Someone will die for this today!

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (...Ahh? ...Where am I...)

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Whee hee hee! It appears that she's finally coming around!

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: We brought this girl here on direct orders from His Majesty. Simple stuff, yes? Very easy, very nice. Then he gives all these special commands! Don't let her escape. Don't let her get sick. Don't let people kill her...More than anyone else, His Highness should know how hard it is to keep one of these birdies healthy...

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Is there a problem?

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Eh? Who do you think you are? Why is it you disturb my meditations! I'm thinking here!

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Um... I'm here to relieve you on guard duty.

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Standing guard, eh? Don't see much reason for a guard in this place. But armies always have all their rules and regulations and appearances and hullabaloo...Ah, no way around it, I suppose.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: I believe that guards and watches are important.

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Wheee! In other places, yes. But Gritnea Tower is currently overflowing with veteran soldiers. Not to mention those repulsive beasts...Those Feral Ones, you know? Trying to escape from this place is the same as committing suicide! Not that I've tried, mind you.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: So a watch is necessary.

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Hmmm? Wheee! What's that now? Who said that?! Oh, it's you. Important, eh? Why's that?

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Weeell...if the girl were to leave her room, we would be unable to stop her from getting killed.

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Ooo! You found a blind spot! That's the problem with us scholars! We concentrate on one thing and miss something as fundamental as--

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Blast! They're getting riled up again... Listen, you! You stay right here and stand guard. Don't let that heron girl take one step outside this room! Do you understand me? Wheee! I told you we needed guards!

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: ...Sigh... Don't worry. I'll take care of everything.

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Bah! Always when I'm in the middle of something... Snaggle-toothed, cheese-stealing...

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Finally! Methinks that guy fell a little far from the nest...Hello, little heron girl. There's nothing to be afraid of. I won't hurt you. Just sit there and be quiet, all right?

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (Where is..this place? Who are you.....?)

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: That took longer than I'd expected. Cursed sub-humans...flea-bitten wretches...Huh? Where's the heron girl? And the...guard? Helloooo? Guard? Bird girl? Wheeeeee? This can't... NO! I've been had! Nooooooooo! What do I do? If this is discovered, His Majesty will... He'll hang me up by my thumbs! Oh, no... Oooooh noooo...! No, no, no! I will not report this!Um... Uh... Think, Izuka, think! Hmmm...If I can somehow divert attention from myself...

intro.speaker: Unknown
intro.line: Master Izuka!

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Gyaaaa!

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Master Izuka! We've got trouble! A strange group of insurgents approaches the tower! They are well armed, sir!...Master Izuka?

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Eh? Insurgents? Wheeee-- Um... Ahem! Did you say insurgents have appeared?

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir! A mixed group of sub-humans and humans.

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Ah... I see, I see. Then we must give them a warm reception, no?

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: General Heddwyn's mages have engaged them, but they're not nearly enough. We must apply to the capital for more reinforcements to--

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Release the Feral Ones.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Th-those monsters? But...

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: No need to worry. I have just given them their medication. They've all been trained not to attack any Daein soldiers.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: V-very well, I--

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: Do it now! The enemy must not be allowed inside the tower.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Y-yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: ...Feh feh feh! Wheeeeeeee!!! What fortuitous timing. Now then, I will take this moment and prepare to make my escape.

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: ...Whew. I thought as much when I first snuck in here, but this really is an unbelievable place. What in Ashera's name is going on? Why are all these crazed laguz creeping about?

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (I hate this!)

intro.speaker: Daein Soldier
intro.line: Hm? Oh, you don't like this, eh? Neither do I. This helmet and armor are horribly restrictive, you know?

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: How's that, Leanne? It's been twenty years, but I'm still quite an eyeful. Don't you agree?

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (You're very handsome, Naesala.)

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Yeah, I haven't changed much, eh? And you knew it was me back there right away, didn't you? Ah, I'm glad you survived. It's very good to see you again.

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (Yes..I am also pleased.)

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Now, on to the problem at hand. We went to the trouble of escaping that tower, so I'd hate to end up a meal for one of our insane cousins. Our objective is to rendezvous with Nealuchi. Here we go, Leanne. Hold on tight.

intro.speaker: Leanne
intro.line: (Yes I will!)

battle.speaker: Naesala
battle.line: What's going on? They're all looking the same direction.

battle.speaker: Naesala
battle.line: Tibarn and friends, eh? Oh, very good. This will work out nicely...

battle.speaker: Nealuchi
battle.line: Ne-nestling!! We've found you at last!

battle.speaker: Naesala
battle.line: Nealuchi! You're here sooner than expected. You pushed your old wings to the limit, didn't you?

battle.speaker: Nealuchi
battle.line: I couldn't be late to the rescue of the dear lady Leanne, now could I?

battle.speaker: Nealuchi
battle.line: Oh! What a glorious sight...You look so much like your dear, departed mother...Sniff...

battle.speaker: Naesala
battle.line: Hey, save your tears for later. While Tibarn and the others take care of the enemy, we must escape.

boss.speaker: Heddwyn
boss.line: This is not good... They're closing in. There are not enough Feral Ones. Someone! Anyone? Haaaalp! Go find Master Izuka at once!

character-falls.speaker: Tibarn
character-falls.line: Oof! I can't believe I'm saying this, but...I must withdraw.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Ike! Any sign of her?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: No, I don't see her anywhere.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Leanne... Where have you gone?

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Hello, everyone. Are you having some sort of problem?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Naesala!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Oh. King Kilvas. How nice.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: I believe I have what you seek right here.

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: (Brother! Oh, my brother!)

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Leanne! You're safe!

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: (Brother! Brother!)

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: ...You? You rescued her?

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Listen, and listen good. I don't want there to be any misunderstandings here. It was Tibarn! He forced me to do this. It wasn't any sense of charity or anything. It was a sort of...payment for the debt I had incurred.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: I knew choosing you would pay off. Excellently done.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Flatter me all you like, hawk king. You'll get nothing in return. As promised, the Duke Tanas account has been completely settled.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Yes, as agreed.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Well then, I take my leave of you.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: There's no need to rush off. Is there? Since you've come all this way, why not stay and help us with King Daein?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What a splendid idea.

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: What? Enough of your nonsense. I prefer to keep my life intact, thank you.

end.speaker: Leanne
end.line: (Naesala, are you leaving?)

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Listen to me, Leanne. I have no good reason to fight the king of Daein.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: No good reason? And what about your fellow Kilvans? King Daein has taken their natural identity and warped it beyond repair!

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: They left Kilvas of their own accord. How far should my responsibility for them extend?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: You...

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: I hate to interrupt, but...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What is it, Nasir?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: I have something I want to show you all. Will you please come below?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: This tower has a basement?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: We just discovered a hidden staircase.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Let's go.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What is that smell?

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: ...It is...corruption.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: It's too dark to see anything. We need light...

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: ...What, what is this? Oh, by the goddess...

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: W-what is this...?! Nasir! Answer me!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Ranulf?

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Laguz... At one time, they were...laguz...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I hope Ranulf and the others are all right. They behaved as if nothing had happened, but...I could sense they were in pain.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: That dungeon was the most vile thing I have ever seen. I'm glad you weren't there.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Was it that bad?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: It was barbaric beyond description... There were more laguz corpses than we could count...They had been tortured. Twisted and warped beyond all recognition.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Ah...such horrors...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Why would Ashnard do such things? What could be his purpose here?

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: ...The king called powerful beorc to his cause. But he had to see if they were worthy. He would test them by pitting them against those laguz. Ashnard considers laguz to be tools in service to his own mad ends. Nothing more. They are instruments to be used as he sees fit. I heard that he  ordered his scholars to perform all kinds of experiments...They used elixirs to drive them mad and keep them locked in their changed states...Their life spans were much shortened, but for a brief time, they became extremely powerful...they...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: ...Thank you for telling us. Thanks to you, we found Leanne. You're free now. You can do whatever you like.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: ...I will go to the capital. Please accept me into your army.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You don't have to do that. Fighting against your former companions could prove difficult.

end.speaker: Ena
end.line: Take me with you. There is something that I have to do. Please, Master Ike.

end.speaker: Nasir
end.line: I ask it of you as well. Please.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: ...Very well. Let's fight together.

end.speaker: Crimean Soldier
end.line: General Ike, the army has arrived at the outskirts of Melior. We await your deployment orders, sir.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Very well. Tell the men to stand down and await my command.

end.speaker: Crimean Soldier
end.line: ...At last, we face the king of Daein.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Yes... The war is coming to an end.

end.speaker: Crimean Soldier
end.line: It appears so.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Hm? Is there something bothering you?

end.speaker: Crimean Soldier
end.line: No, of course not. It's nothing like that. But...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: But what?

end.speaker: Crimean Soldier
end.line: Some... Some of the soldiers are saying that when the war's over, their chances for promotion will dry up.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: They want to continue fighting? Even though Crimea--and Daein, too-- have suffered so much?

end.speaker: Crimean Soldier
end.line: No, that's not what I mean...I apologize. I will go inform the men.

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Well done! You've improved dramatically in a very short period of time.

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: Do you think so?

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: I do not know how to lie or offer false praise. I am deputy commander of the apostle's bodyguards. If you were not destined for greater things, I would petition the apostle herself for your enlistment.

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: Oh, thank you! I can't believe it myself. If not for your instruction, Tanith...This would not be possible.

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Training new recruits has long been my duty. And yet...I believe this is the first time anyone has been so appreciative. My other pupils commonly referred to me as the Great Demon. Isn't that so, Marcia?

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: Great Demon? Mutton chops, no! D-don't be silly! We all adored our sincere and devoted deputy commander. Great Demon. Pfff! More like Great...uh...Angel...Lady...

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Ha! Sure. Seriously though, you've improved so much, Princess... Perhaps we should try something special...

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: What? N-not that! She's not ready for that! You're crazy!

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: Tanith, I...I'm not sure that I'm ready...

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Listen to me, Princess. The foes we are facing are Daein's elite troops, led by King Ashnard himself. How do you expect to fight them without at least one killing attack under your belt?

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: You do it, Deputy Commander, and we'll keep practicing. Right, Princess Elincia?

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: I... I will try it.

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: Whaaaaat?!

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: I want...to grow stronger. To reach that goal, I will do whatever it takes.

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Well spoken! Now then...to match your desire, I will fall back on the methods I used while training the apostle's bodyguards.

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: All...right...

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: Oh, horsemeat...

conversation.speaker: Tanith
conversation.line: Come, we have little time for niceties. Both of you, follow me! Now!!! Come on, maggots, do you want to live forever?!!!

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: Y-yes, ma'am!

conversation.speaker: Marcia
conversation.line: Ugh... She really is a demon.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Hmm... The three of them look...busy...I think I'll wait until later to talk to them.
